context: George Brown College has a Supplier Code of Ethics policy that sets high standards for suppliers' conduct in business dealings with the college. The policy covers all suppliers and employees who work with them, requiring adherence to ethical behavior, fairness, personal integrity, and applicable laws. Suppliers are expected to conduct negotiations ethically without attempting to influence purchasing decisions through offering personal gifts or other unethical means. They must also maintain good business standing and inform the college of any changes that might affect purchasing decisions. The policy applies globally, and "Supplier" refers to any entity selling goods or services to the college, including their employees, agents, and representatives. Suppliers are required to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and policies, and are prohibited from offering or accepting kickbacks, favors, or anything of value to obtain favorable treatment from the college. Any conflicts of interest or the appearance thereof must also be disclosed and corrected, and suppliers cannot fix prices or rig bids with competitors.
